intro: Phyllorkis flavida, commonly known as the golden flax lily, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30-60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often used in floral arrangements due to their vibrant color and durability. Phyllorkis flavida is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
